steps.content: For instance, it might be 5 by 5 cm (2.0 by 2.0 in).

steps.title: Sketch the 5 centimeter (2.0 in) line.
steps.content: Sketch the 5 centimeter (2.0 in) line. Using your compass, measure from the point to the pencil at 5 centimeter (2.0 in).

steps.title: Put your compass at one end of your baseline.
steps.content: Put your compass at one end of your baseline. Doing this, draw part of a circle. Repeat with the other end of the baseline. Doing this, you should have both lines crossing in the middle. This part is difficult, but don't worry.

steps.title: You should end up with a triangle.
steps.content: You should end up with a triangle.

steps.title: Rub out the lines you used in part 3.
steps.content: Rub out the lines you used in part 3.

steps.title: To one side, draw an extension like another side like in Fig.3.
steps.content: To one side, draw an extension like another side like in Fig.3. Make sure the baseline of that side is above the first baseline you drew.
